com.eemi.ext4j.client.field

Class FieldBase

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.UIObject
      • com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget
        • com.eemi.ext4j.client.core.AbstractComponent
          • com.eemi.ext4j.client.core.Component
            • com.eemi.ext4j.client.ui.BoxComponent
              • com.eemi.ext4j.client.field.Field
                • com.eemi.ext4j.client.field.FieldBase
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Observable, com.google.gwt.event.logical.shared.HasAttachHandlers, com.google.gwt.event.shared.HasHandlers, com.google.gwt.user.client.EventListener, com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.HasVisibility, com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.IsWidget
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CheckBox, Display, Hidden, HtmlEditor, MultiSlider, TextField

    public class FieldBase
extends Field
    Base class for form fields that provides default event handling, rendering, and other common functionality needed by all form field types

    • Method Detail

      • getXType

        public java.lang.String getXType()
        Description copied from class: Component
        Gets the xtype for this component as registered with ComponentManager. For a list of all available xtypes, see the Component javadocs. 

         
 
        
 TextField field = new TextField();
 field.getXType() returns "textfield"
        Overrides:
        getXType in class Field
        Returns:
        the xtype

      • setBaseCls

        public void setBaseCls(java.lang.String value)
        The base CSS class to apply to this component's element. This will also be prepended to elements within this component like NotificationContainer's body will get a class x-panel-body. This means that if you create a subclass of NotificationContainer, and you want it to get all the Panels styling for the element and the body, you leave the baseCls x-panel and use componentCls to add specific styling for this component.

        Defaults to: Ext.baseCSSPrefix + 'field'

        Overrides:
        setBaseCls in class Component

      • setCheckChangeBuffer

        public void setCheckChangeBuffer(double value)
        Defines a timeout in milliseconds for buffering checkChangeEvents that fire in rapid succession. Defaults to 50 milliseconds.

        Defaults to: 50

      • setCheckChangeEvents

        public void setCheckChangeEvents(com.google.gwt.core.client.JsArrayString values)
        Defines a timeout in milliseconds for buffering checkChangeEvents that fire in rapid succession. Defaults to 50 milliseconds.

        Defaults to: 50

      • setDirtyCls

        public void setDirtyCls(java.lang.String value)
        The CSS class to use when the field value is dirty.

        Defaults to: Ext.baseCSSPrefix + 'form-dirty'

      • setFieldStyle

        public void setFieldStyle(java.lang.String value)
        Optional CSS style(s) to be applied to the field input element. Should be a valid argument to Ext.Element.applyStyles. Defaults to undefined. See also the setFieldStyle method for changing the style after initialization.

      • setFieldCls

        public void setFieldCls(java.lang.String value)
        The default CSS class for the field input

        Defaults to: 'x-form-field'

      • setFocusCls

        public void setFocusCls(java.lang.String value)
        The CSS class to use when the field receives focus

        Defaults to: 'x-form-focus'

      • setInputAttrTpl

        public void setInputAttrTpl(java.lang.String value)
        An optional string or XTemplate configuration to insert in the field markup inside the input element (as attributes). If an XTemplate is used, the component's subTpl data serves as the context.

      • setInputAttrTpl

        public void setInputAttrTpl(com.google.gwt.core.client.JsArrayString value)
        An optional string or XTemplate configuration to insert in the field markup inside the input element (as attributes). If an XTemplate is used, the component's subTpl data serves as the context.

      • setInputAttrTpl

        public void setInputAttrTpl(Template value)
        An optional string or XTemplate configuration to insert in the field markup inside the input element (as attributes). If an XTemplate is used, the component's subTpl data serves as the context.

      • setInputId

        public void setInputId(java.lang.String value)
        The id that will be given to the generated input DOM element. Defaults to an automatically generated id. If you configure this manually, you must make sure it is unique in the document.

      • setInputType

        public void setInputType(java.lang.String value)
        The type attribute for input fields -- e.g. radio, text, password, file. The extended types supported by HTML5 inputs (url, email, etc.) may also be used, though using them will cause older browsers to fall back to 'text'.

        The type 'password' must be used to render that field type currently -- there is no separate Ext component for that. You can use Ext.form.field.File which creates a custom-rendered file upload field, but if you want a plain unstyled file input you can use a Base with inputType:'file'.

        Defaults to: 'text'

        Overrides:
        setInputType in class Field
        Parameters:
        value - the input type

      • setInvalidText

        public void setInvalidText(java.lang.String value)
        The error text to use when marking a field invalid and no message is provided

        Defaults to: 'The value in this field is invalid'

        Overrides:
        setInvalidText in class Field
        Parameters:
        value - invalid text on error
        See Also:
        TextField#setValidator(Validator)

      • setReadOnly

        public void setReadOnly(boolean value)
        true to mark the field as readOnly in HTML.

        Note: this only sets the element's readOnly DOM attribute. Setting readOnly=true, for example, will not disable triggering a ComboBox or Date; it gives you the option of forcing the user to choose via the trigger without typing in the text box. To hide the trigger use hideTrigger.

        Defaults to: false

        Overrides:
        setReadOnly in class Field
        Parameters:
        value - true to mark field read only

      • setReadOnlyCls

        public void setReadOnlyCls(java.lang.String value)
        The CSS class applied to the component's main element when it is readOnly. Defaults to: Ext.baseCSSPrefix + 'form-readonly'

      • setTabIndex

        public void setTabIndex(int value)
        The tabIndex for this field. Note this only applies to fields that are rendered, not those which are built via applyTo
        Overrides:
        setTabIndex in class Field
        Parameters:
        value - the fields tab index

      • getInputElement

        public ExtElement getInputElement()
        The input Element for this Field. Only available after the field has been rendered.

      • setValidateOnBlur

        public void setValidateOnBlur(boolean value)
        The input Element for this Field. Only available after the field has been rendered.

        Available since: Ext 4

        Overrides:
        setValidateOnBlur in class Field
        Parameters:
        value - true to validate on blur

      • getInputId

        public java.lang.String getInputId()
        Returns the input id for this field. If none was specified via the inputId config, then an id will be automatically generated.

      • getRawValue

        public java.lang.String getRawValue()
        Returns the raw value of the field, without performing any normalization, conversion, or validation.
        Overrides:

        Returns:

      • addSpecialKeyHandler

        public HandlerRegistration addSpecialKeyHandler(SpecialKeyHandler handler)
        Fires when any key related to navigation (arrows, tab, enter, esc, etc.) is pressed. To handle other keys see Ext.util.KeyMap. You can check Ext.EventObject.getKey to determine which key was pressed.
        Parameters:
        handler - , the handler that will handle the event
